alert.note: Alert for Escambia Coastal; Okaloosa Coastal; Santa Rosa Coastal (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued September 28 at 5:35AM EDT until September 29 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents expected. * WHERE...In Alabama, Mobile Coastal and Baldwin Coastal Counties. In Florida, Escambia Coastal, Santa Rosa Coastal and Okaloosa Coastal Counties. * WHEN...Through Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Swell associated with Hurricane Ian will increase today leading to dangerous rip currents along area beaches through Thursday evening.
info.instruction: Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.

area.areaDesc: Escambia Coastal; Okaloosa Coastal; Santa Rosa Coastal
